N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2186.8 - Audit and monitoring

State Regulations
(a) Access
to records. The agency or its designated agent will have access to all books, accounts, records, reports, files and other papers or property of grantees
pertaining to funds provided through the program for the purposes of making
surveys, audits, examinations, excerpts and transcripts. (b) Independent audits. The grantee is
responsible for obtaining, and paying for, an independent audit of the
expenditure of grant funds. The audit is to be conducted in accordance with
guidelines prescribed by the agency which the agency may permit to be part of
any other independent audit obtained with respect to the affordable housing
project. (c) Additional audits. The
agency or its designated agent may undertake such further or additional audits
as it finds necessary or appropriate. Notes
